data.title: Coffee Shop on The Square
data.text: A great place to stop in after a walk around New Braunfel's historic downtown. The coffees are big and they have sandwiches and muffins. A nice place to pop in as you are wandering around.

data.title: One overwhelmed employee
data.text:
We stopped in for a soup and a sandwich at 7pm on a Saturday.  There was one employee trying to do everything.    The line was 7 deep and not moving.  Several tables were occupied by people waiting for their food and drinks.  Other tables needed to be bussed.   There was one lady who had waited over 15 minutes for 2 chocolate shakes and the employee had forgotten all about her. 

We decided to not eat because it would take too long.  We got coffee and got out.   

It's a nice place.  The menu is good. I think they just need to invest in some labor to get everyone served.  I'm betting that most of those customers won't be back.

data.title: Cookies
data.text:
Awesome cookies and toffee!! Beautiful location historic building. Honey latte was tasty
Will visit again.  Sweet cashiers

data.title: Splendid Coffee!
data.text: Located on the downtown circle, in front of the gazebo is this quaint coffee shop! We sat outside under the bright awning at tables with umbrellas and we were served here after ordering! Just ordered coffee but she brought us a "little sweet" crunchy toffee bar for us to try! How thoughtful!!! She must have recognized our "sweet tooth" and accommodated it!!! Great experience!!!

data.title: Truly Wonderful
data.text: What a beautiful and quaint establishment for breakfast/brunch. Get here early before it becomes swamped with tourist. 😊 great atmosphere, beautiful scenery and such good food. Enjoy.

data.title: Good Place For Light Breakfast
data.text: We had breakfast here one morning.  The smoothie and coffee that we ordered was fantastic, and we each had a "omelet in a bowl."  We really enjoyed the atmosphere as well.

data.title: Cup of coffee
data.text: Great coffee and cookies!! Quiet place, but  nice atmosphere. Wish I had a place like this... nice location, workers.....

data.title: Nice place for a latte
data.text: I love this little coffe shop.... It has a wonderful atmosphere and awesome treats.  I used to buy all my republic of tea and my tea accessories here.  They have pastries and such to choose from for eating and snacks

data.title: Excellent breakfast and bakery
data.text: Very good, upscale, omelettes and breakfasts, without the upscale prices.  The German bakery is also very good.  Service is friendly and efficient.  The walls are adorned with local artists paintings for sale (great talent).  The place is a business man's dream for breakfast and lunch.  I believe the restaurant is also open for dinner Thurs - Sat.

data.title: They have potential!
data.text:
Gosh, they could do so much more with this place.
It doesn't seem like it gets too busy when we go, but it also seems like we are getting the "left over" bakery items.  Coffee is ok.
I'd rather support local coffee houses over Starbux any day, so I'll go back.  They need an update!

data.title: Great place for coffee, pastries and cookies!
data.text:
This bakery is right across the street from the courthouse! We went for coffee, and grabbed some pastries and cookies. They were great. The place was sunny and bright. It felt very clean, and the cookies were great. This was far more relaxed than some of the other bakeries in the area, which although good, tend to be hectic. 
Because I went for coffee, I did not look at the other food they had. I just perused the pastry display cases!

data.title: Coffee Shop
data.text: I love this coffe shop! The coffee here is always great and lots of yummy desserts to choose from too!

data.title: Quaint. Happy.
data.text: Love this little place. Friendly staff. Good coffee. Fried eggs are delish. Ham, egg, cheese sandwich nothing special. So bright and happy inside. We stop here every time we are in NB.

data.title: cool off spot
data.text: Hot August day, walking around town. Stopped in and had a strawberry smoothie. Good cool down drink.

data.title: Eh.
data.text: The coffee is nothing special, the sandwiches are nothing special, the servers are nothing special ... this is a "last resort" kind of place.  I always feel like I'm bothering the wait staff.  Some like it, so if I'm meeting someone who really wants to go there, I'm fine with it, but I'd MUCH prefer to go next door to Crosswalk Coffeehouse.

data.title: Quaint
data.text: Quaint place on the square. The breakfast sandwich was mediocre -- a few slices of pre-packaged ham, an egg and bland toast. The atmosphere is good and their drip coffee wasn't bad. If they spruce up the menu a bit I'd recommend it, but for now you can find better food for the price somewhere else.

data.title: My daily visit to this cafe is like homecoming
data.text: The owner and personnel are fun if you want conversation. The soups sandwhiches pastries blended drinks splendid. Breakfasts and lunches freshly and quickly made. Desserts and coffees are great anytime . Enjoy outside seating also hear the courthouse bells and watch the roundabout traffic flow  around gazebo .you will want to return often.

data.title: Bad Breakfast
data.text: The soufflé is ridiculous, a tiny little something out of the microwave (plus they forgot to take it out and serve it), tasted like nothing. The Belgian Waffle for nearly 8 bucks is insulting. Sorry.

data.title: Sandwitch shop
data.text: Good breakfast/lunch salads/sandwiches; and good home-made soups.   It is located in the center of the town,

data.title: Quick breakfast and coffee
data.text: On Christmas Eve morning tried to find some place for breakfast. Found the coffee house and stopped in to give it a try.  They were out of bagels so I had a breakfast sandwich on a croissant.  It was a good basic sandwich. A good place for breakfast.
